alert.note: Alert for Reagan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 10:25PM CDT until June 28 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Reagan County in western Texas... * Until 130 AM CDT. * At 1025 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Best, Texon, and along U.S. HWY 67 and RR 1555. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
